instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: Graphic card 5mb after smc replacement
threads.message:
Hi guys,


Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with liquid damage. After all repair ( finally i had to replace SMC) it is working but only detect 5mb graphic card. I guess it is because smc donor and smc ori are not same. Can u help me how i have to reprogram it to read whole graphic card MBs.?

threads.title: Graphic card 5mb after smc replacement
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with Intel Integrated Graphics.
There is no dedicated (discrete) GPU.

You always MUST replace SMC with one from the same board...

threads.title: Graphic card 5mb after smc replacement
threads.message: ok, bought 980YFE. Will change with it when arrived.  So there is no way to reprogram it ?

threads.title: Graphic card 5mb after smc replacement
threads.message:
Is important to get the SMC from exactly the same scrap board.
New chip is useless...
